Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yeah, I'm not a temp anymore. I got Jim's uh, old job. Which means at my 10 year high school reunion it will not say "Ryan Howard is a temp." It will say "Ryan Howard is a junior sales associate at a mid-range paper supply firm. ...that'll show 'em.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [after "the kiss"] You have no idea how long I've wanted to do that.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Me too. ...I think we're just drunk.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No I'm not drunk. Are you drunk?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No... [Jim leans in for another kiss] Jim--

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Are you really gonna marry him? [Pam nods] ...Ok.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [sobbing] Jim is gone. He's gone. I miss him so much. Ooooh I cry myself to sleep, Jim! [serious] False. I do not miss him.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No! That is the fun of this place. I call everybody "faggie". Why would anybody find that offensive?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: OK I think Oscar would just like if you used "lame" or something like that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's what faggie means!

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: No not really...

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Apparently you called Oscar "faggie" for liking the movie Shakespeare in Love more than an action movie.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It wasn't just an action movie, it was Die Hard!

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: All right Michael, but Oscar's really gay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Exactly!

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I mean for real.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, I know.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: No, I mean he's attracted to other men.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: OK, a little too far, crossed the line.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: OK, I am telling you, Oscar is an actual homosexual. Yeah, he told me this morning. And, obviously he hopes he can count on your discretion.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I would have never called him that if I knew. You don't... You don't call retarded people "retards". It's bad taste. You call your friends "retards" when they're acting retarded. And I consider Oscar a friend.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Listen man, I am so sorry. I had no idea.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: No, it's fine.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. No it's not. I feel terrible about it. I have been calling people "faggie" since I was in junior high, and I have never made this mistake. If I don't know how to behave, it is because I am just so far the opposite way, you know? I'm just... I, I can't even imagine... the... thing. Maybe we could go out for a beer sometime. And you could tell me... how... you do that to another dude.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: That sounds like a great, wonderful idea, let's do that.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [in reference to Oscar being gay] It explains so much.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: No, I'm not gay. And I don't understand why anyone would think, that I'm gay... if... [sighs] Uh... yeah I'm gay.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I can't say whether Dunder Mifflin paper is less flammable, sir, but I can assure that it is certainly not more flammable.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Why did I transfer to Stamford? I think that's pretty obvious. I got promoted! And you can't beat that view... right?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey, Big Tuna! You're single right?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Uh-huh, yeah. I am.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: She's pretty hot huh? [Jim nods] She's completely crazy. Steer clear Big Tuna. Head for open waters.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: OooOK.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: OooOK.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I ate a tuna sandwich, on my first day. So, Andy started calling me Big Tuna. ...I don't think any of them actually know my real name.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Big Tuna is a super ambitious guy, you know? Cut your throat to get ahead kind of guy, but I mean I'm not threatened by him. I went to Cornell, you ever heard of it? [laughs] I graduated in four years. I never studied once. I was drunk the whole time, and I sang in the acappella group, "Here Comes Treble."

Quote.Speaker: Josh
Quote.Text: So, end of day we are going to have a little diversity policy refresher, because of some more problems at the Scranton branch. And I have a list of business startups I got from the chamber. Yes, I am going to need someone to cold call them.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, I can do that.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Jim's nice enough. I dont... I don't know how well he's fitting in here. He's always looking at the camera like this. [makes classic "Jim"-camera face] What is that?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Can you tell who's gay and who's not?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Of course.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What about Oscar?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Absolutely not.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, he is.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well, he's not dressed in women's clothes, so...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [deep sigh] There could be others... I need to know. I don't want to offend anybody else.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You could assume everyone is, and not say anything offensive.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, I'm sure everyone would appreciate me treating them like they were gay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, what about Angela? She's hard and severe. She could be a gay woman.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I really don't think so.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't know, I can imagine her with another woman, can't you?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [creepy smile]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Do some research. Find out if there's a way to tell by just looking at them.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Jim told me you could buy gay-dar online.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's ridiculous.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah probably. He didn't tell the truth a lot.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [sighs] Let's call him and get the website.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Definitely.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What's gay-dar? Oh, oh, gay-dar, yes! No, uh, I think they have it at Sharper Image. Oh, you know what? I could check for you. No problem. [loudly fake typing] It's sold out! Yeah sorry about that, that's a bummer.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, they're sold out.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Damn. [thinks] I'll try Brookstone.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I miss that.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Chicken or fish?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [loud sigh] Chicken.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: So you havin' a good day?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Excellent, thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Good, glad. OK.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, I didn't go through with the wedding. I got cold feet, a few days before. And I can't really explain it. I just had to get out of that relationship. We still had to pay for all the food. So we froze it. But I'm, I'm doing well. I have my own apartment. I'm taking art classes. And I have lunch for the next five weeks.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: After Pam dumped me, I um, I kinda stopped taking care of myself there, and uh, I hit bottom when uh, drunk driving arrest. I've been working out and um, you know, I'm not gonna take her for granted. I gotta win her back.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I got them a toaster. They called off the wedding and gave the toaster back to me. I tried to return the toaster to the store, and they said they no longer sold that kind of toaster. So now my house has got two toasters.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: That is so cool that you're gay. I totally underestimated you.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Yes I'm super cool. I am an accountant at a failing paper supply company, Scranton. Much like, um, sir Ian McClellan.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Sure, sometimes I watch Will and Grace... and I want to throw up. It's terribly loud. I do like it sometimes when Harry Connick Jr. is on. He's so talented.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: OK. Who put my calculator in Jello? Good one. But uh, seriously, guys who did this? Seriously guys, who did this? I need to know who put my calculator in Jello, or I'm gonna lose MY FRICKIN' MIND!

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: You know, it's amazing to me that in this day and age, you could be so obtuse about sexual orientation.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I watch the L Word. I watch, Queer as F***, so...

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: That's not what it's called.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: OK, Michael, are you aware that you ousted Oscar today?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What? What does that even...

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Coming out, is a significant moment for a gay person, and they should be allowed to select the timing and manner of announcing it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, gay pride, right? Gay pride parade? It's not like gay... shame festival.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: All right, now Oscar's feeling discriminated against by his co-workers, primarily Angela, and um, that's your fault.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I think Angela might be gay. Could Oscar and Angela be having a gay affair? Maybe! Is that what this is about?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: NO!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't kn-

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: No, it's not possible.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Anything's possible.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: You know, imagine... you were gay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [laughs] Well, I'm not gay Jan, and you should know that better than anybody!

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Michael, your immaturity is extremely disappointing and may even lead to a lawsuit which is the absolute last thing this company needs right now. Do you understand?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: The company has made it my responsibility today to put an end to 100,000 years of being weirded out by gays.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Am I the first gay man you ever knew?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Trick question! Cause you can't always tell, so... how would I know. Is that the right answer?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael, Dwight's looking at gay pornography on his computer.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Uh, Michael knows Pam. He asked me to do this just for him. He has his own reasons.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [looking at gay porn] Nothing wrong with this stuff. At all. This is fine. You know what. Gay porn, straight porn, it's all goooooood! I don't particularly get into this. But uh, you know what. I totally see the merit! And actually... it is quite beautiful.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ah damn pop-ups.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: What are you doing?!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Watching some of your friends.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [yelling] All right, everybody in the conference room! I don't care if you are gay, or straight, or a lesbian, or overweight! JUST GET IN HERE! RIGHT NOW!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Did you know that gay used to mean happy? When I was growing up it meant lame. And now it means a man, who makes love... to other men.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We're all homos! Homosapiens. Gays aren't necessarily who you think they are, people. I mean anybody could be gay. Business-men. Like antique dealers, or hairdressers, or... accountants. Oscar, why don't you take this opportunity to officially come out, to everybody here. However you want to do it. Go ahead. Stand up. I'm doing this for you.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Yes I'm gay. And I didn't plan on sharing that part of my life with you today, so, whatever. Can I sit down now?

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: I'm not offended by homosexuality. In the sixties I made love to many many women, often outdoors, in the mud and the rain. And it was possible a man slipped in, and there would be no way of knowing.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Who should be the judges and juries of our society?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Judges and juries!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, that's a good point. She has a good point. Because gay marriage currently is not legal, under U.S. law. I bet a lot of straight men wish that applied to them. So they could go out there and have some torrid unabashed monkey sex as much as they could. You know? Sounds pretty good, right?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: That sounds great.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I think all the other office gays should identify themselves, or I will do it for them.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: No one else in this office is gay.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What about Phyllis? She makes absolutely no attempt to be feminine!

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I'm getting married to Bob Vance.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's great. Congratulations Phyllis. That is great, and frankly kiiiiiiiind of amazing! [laughs] See? Everybody has a chance!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: But still, Phyllis, in college? Did you ever experiment with other women? A lot of women do!

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: No, you knew me in high school. Course, we all thought you were gay in high school.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [laughing] Right! [serious] And I take that as a compliment.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Well with your ties and your matching socks and --

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, I just like to look good OK, so --

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: You sound pretty defensive Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, I am just coming out myself. I am coming out hetero!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I think the problem with this office is that you are sending mixed signals about my being here.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No no no. The only signal that I am sending is: Gay, good.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Look, if I was gay, I would be the most flamboyant gay you have ever seen. I would be leading the parade covered in feathers, and just... I would be waving that rainbow flag.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I don't think I can work here any longer. This has been the worst, most backwards day of my life.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You misunderstand- OK. You know what, OK. I uh, I'm gonna put my money where my mouth is. You ready? I am going to embrace Oscar. You might want to watch this Angela, because you can't catch anything. Here we go. We are going to make a statement. You and I are going to make a statement together. Oscar is my friend --

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I would rather not.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: ...and I just don't care who sees it, doesn't bother me!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: No, NO! I don't want to touch you, ever consider that? You're ignorant, and insulting, and small!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right, um... sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Michael... I'm sorry. That was a good idea. Come on, come on. [Oscar and Michael hug]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [sobbing] I'm sorry I called you faggie. You're not faggie. You're a a good guy.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Michael appears to be gay too. And yet he is my friend. I guess I do have a gay friend.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [embracing Oscar]You know what, I'm going to raise the stakes. I want you to watch this. And I want you to burn this into your brains. Because this is an image that I want you people to remember for a long time to come. Whenever you come into the office I want you to think about this. [awkwardly kissing Oscar] I did it. See. I'm still here. We're all still here. [everyone claps]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [Dwight gets up to kiss Oscar] Oh come on! Dwight! Come on, man!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We are not in the playground anymore. There are new rules. We have to be mature. But we can't lose the spirit of child like wonder. What is love... anyway? Maybe it's supposed to break all the rules. Like me and Jan. Or Oscar... and some guy. Life is short. When two people find each other, what should stand in their way?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I am glad that today spurred social change. That's part of my job as regional manager. But you know what? Even if it didn't, at least we put this matter to bed. ...that's what she said. Or he said.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, there's Gill. Oscar's roommate. I wonder if he knows?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I was going to quit. But Jan offered me a three month paid vacation and a company car. All I had to do was sign something saying I won't sue. Gill and I are going to Europe. Kids, sometimes it pays to be gay.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [reading the note with the gay-dar] "Hope this helps. -Jim" Nice!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [Dwight is running the gay-dar over Oscar's body] What are you doing?!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Shhh. Don't be scared. [gay-dar beeps over Oscar's belt buckle, Dwight smiles] It works. [gay-dar goes off next to Dwight's belt buckle] ...oh no.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: [on speakerphone] Okay, what is your goal for after lunch?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I will do my job to the best of my abilities.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: [under breath] Heaven help us. [aloud] Specifically.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I will do my regional manager job to the best of my capability.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Specifically, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Specifically, Jan, I will make at least ten phone calls to clients.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, I have to begin every day by letting Jan know what I intend to accomplish, and then I have to call her at the end of the day to tell her what I did accomplish. But it's not mandatory. It's something that I... wanted to do... and so it's voluntary, really. Even though she... makes me. I think she just wants to hear my voice. Because we're no longer lovers, and she's just hurting. But things are going well with Carol. I've seen her seven times in the last few months, and I'm growing very fond of her kids. Tommy, who I call Tomas, and the little girl...

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: [on speakerphone] Are you on the toilet, Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [quietly] No.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Well, I know sometimes you are and... that you wouldn't tell me, so I'm just going to assume that you are, and call me back when you're finished.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. [Jan hangs up. Toby opens the office door.]

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [sigh]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hi, honey. You holding up?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yup.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm... painting my new apartment tonight.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, good. By yourself?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Aw. Well, hang in there, okay? You know what? You should get one of this big body pillows. That way you wouldn't miss you-know-who so much.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Roy.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Right.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What do I think? I think everybody should stay out of everybody's personal business!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Yes, I'm gay.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: [shocked expression]

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Why are all the best-looking single men always gay?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey, Big Tuna. You ever Google "Google"? What do you think would happen?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Let's find out. [starts typing]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [makes frustrated noises]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh! Lots of results.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I didn't mean you should do it. You were supposed to ponder it. It's... You removed the fun. Thanks a lot, Big Tuna.
